name: Path N Testis
title: Pathologic N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Involvement of inguinal, pelvic, or external iliac lymph nodes  **WITHOUT** previous scrotal or inguinal surgery prior to presentation of the testis tumor is coded in M (distant metastasis), as distant lymph node involvement.

**Note 2:** Determine the size of the largest metastasis in a lymph node as documented in the pathology report to assign N, **not** the size of the lymph node. If the size of the metastasis is not documented, determine the size of the largest involved lymph node as documented pathologically or clinically with pathology taking priority. Do **not** code the size of any node(s) coded in M (distant metastasis).

**Note 3:** Size of lymph nodes must be known to assign N. You may use a physicianâs statement of the N category if this is the only information in the medical record. 
* If the size of the lymph node(s) is not known, assign N1. 

**Regional lymph nodes:**
     
    Aortic, NOS:
       Lateral (lumbar)
       Para-aortic
       Periaortic
       Preaortic 
       Retroaortic
    Pericaval, NOS:
       Interaortocaval
       Paracaval
       Precaval
       Retrocaval
    Retroperitoneal, NOS
    Spermatic vein

    Regional lymph nodes, NOS
    Lymph nodes, NOS
     
**Regional lymph nodes WITH previous scrotal or inguinal surgery** 
    
    External iliac
    Inguinal nodes, NOS:
       Deep, NOS
       Node of Cloquet or Rosenmuller (highest deep inguinal)
       Superficial (femoral)
    Pelvic, NOS
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not stated
Surgical resection of primary and pathologic assessment of regional nodes are done but involvement of regional nodes not documented in patient record

Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 or less in greatest dimension OR 

5 or fewer positive nodes, none more than 2 cm in greatest dimension

Single or multiple nodes not stated, size not stated

Stated as N1

Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension  OR 

More than 5 nodes positive, none more than 5 cm in greatest dimension  OR

Evidence of extranodal extension of tumor

Single or multiple nodes not stated, size stated and greater than 2 cm but less than or equal to 5 cm

Stated as N2
Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension
Clinically no nodes positive and no pathologic evaluation of nodes
In situ case as defined by TNM and there is a resection of the primary but the nodes are not evaluated pathologically
Pathologic N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No pathologic evaluation of regional lymph nodes and case is not in situ
Regional lymph node(s) cannot be assessed pathologically
No resection of a known primary (not T0)
No surgical resection of primary tumor and no positive biopsy of the highest N 
Unknown if any pathologic assessment performed
